ratings.question_text: Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.

What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I got more confident writing and reading in german.
I developed a greater understanding of German current events as well as improved my speaking, grammar, and vocabulary skills.

I gained a deeper appreciation for German culture, as well as a deeper understanding of present-day Germany. I did not know much about Germany going into the course, but I honed my German skills and understanding about the actual culture itself through this course! Before going into this course, speaking was my worst skillset in the German language, but now I feel much more confident in not only speaking but also writing/reading German.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Strength is communication growth but cultural immersion could maybe be improved

Strengths -
Set up well for your success
Improves your everyday German language skills (not just grammar knowledge)

Weaknesses - 
Could get a little boring at times

The course was very well-structured and engaging, especially as there were various forms of learning we used (e.g. books, news clips, movies). Sometimes the breakout rooms would be a bit awkward, but I feel that has more to do with the atmosphere of virtual learning than it did with the course itself.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments:
Talkabroad was very helpful
Quizlet mandatory assignments  could become redundant

The laying out of course material and activities under the modules tab in Canvas was a very effective way to organizing and communicating the trajectory of the course to the students. The TalkAbroad sessions were also very helpful for improving our speaking skills. More interactive activities such as the Quizlet Live or Kahoot could have increased engagement.
Again, the breakout rooms could be a bit awkward as the class was very small and the rooms were often one-on-one, but I feel like this can be chalked up to the general practice of virtual learning.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Absolutely, if you are interested in German society and culture.
Yes. It is great L5 German course if you want to continue practicing your German skills in a low stress language course.

Definitely! I think this is the best L5 German course to take if you want to take more German courses in the future, or if you just want a holistic understanding of the culture. It was an amazing way to both learn more about the culture itself and the country's contemporary news (e.g. the Syrian refugee crisis, how it is dealing with present-day antisemitism, etc.) while also honing your skills in the actual language.
